messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unschooling Handbook
messages.msgSnippet: I won this book last year in a raffle at a home-ed festival!  It s great, I m really glad I have it.  Now if I can only win the Teenage Liberation Handbook, I
messages.messageBody:
I won this book last year in a raffle at a home-ed festival! It's great,
I'm really glad I have it. Now if I can only win the Teenage
Liberation Handbook, I think I'll manage!!

Tracy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unschooling Handbook
messages.msgSnippet: BlankYes, Kim, I ve read it. We are not yet unschooling but we are definitely considering, mostly thanks to this book! Shirley ... From: Kim To:
messages.messageBody:
Blank
Yes, Kim, I've read it. We are not yet unschooling but we are definitely considering, mostly thanks to this book!
 
Shirley
----- Original Message -----
From: Kim
To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, August 30, 2000 9:52 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unschooling Handbook


Hi All,
I just had to share this.  My friend who is an avid unschooler, just lent me a book titled, 'The Unschooling Handbook' by Mary Griffith.  It is a wonderful book!  I couldn't put it down!  I have already read half of the book today!  I recommend it to anyone who is unschooling, thinking about unschooling, unschools but has doubts about their kids not learning anything, READ IT!!!!  I wish that I would have found this book a long time ago!
Has anyone else on this list read it?
Kim

Kim,
I HAVE!! It is excellent.
BTW-I'm a lurker here. Not a true un-s-ler yet. But getting there.
I'm Jolene-have 4 : B~9 yrs, twin G~6 1/2 yrs & G~4yrs

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unschooling Handbook
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/30/00 5:54:31 PM Pacific Daylight Time, sinclai@EARthlink.net writes:  Sure. It was one of the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/30/00 5:54:31 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
sinclai@... writes:

<< Has anyone else on this list read it? >>

Sure. It was one of the first homeschooling books I read, fortunately. It
helped me to give my daughter a greater degree of freedom when we started
homeschooling. I'm still not where I want to be on this, but the book was
quite helpful in getting this far.
candice
